"Det andet er, at trivsel ikke m√• blive den enkeltes politiske projekt. Det skal v√¶re vores alles projekt, og det skal det ogs√• v√¶re ud i fremtiden. Den sidste er, at vi skal t√¶nke p√• studerende som komplette mennesker. -S√∏ren Kuhberg, PF @DaneCommaPro #uddpol #DTUTopm√∏de

"Men pilen peger ogs√• p√• politikere. Der er et stort eksternt pres p√• studerende, og det er jer, som s√¶tter rammerne for vores uddannelser. Jeg har pr√∏vet at tage tre emner, hvor jeg mener, at I som politikere kan spille ind. -S√∏ren Kuhberg, PF @DaneCommaPro #uddpol #DTUTopm√∏de

To meet these challenges, DTU and the research consortium will draw on extensive experience with floating wind turbines and improve tools and methods used to design and launch the floaters. Full story here: https://t.co/wdKtwK7hQE
Challenge 4: Fatigue in the mooring system. Long waves, which come in groups, create oscillations in the mooring system. This can lead to metal fatigue in the anchor cables. https://t.co/n2ItrhOamN

Challenge 3: Extreme waves hit floaters. Floating offshore wind turbines can be hit by extreme waves. It can create great pressure when water crashes into the steel structure and creates oscillations in the foundation and turbine. https://t.co/C3T54GLfgh
Challenge 2: Vibrations in the turbine tower. Strong winds and high waves expose floating offshore wind turbines to vibrations on the open sea. https://t.co/3Rb7xX8FsS
Challenge 1: Installation on the open sea. Installing a floating offshore wind turbine is more susceptible to the elements than a fixed-base turbine. https://t.co/gkVHhvcYqV

Floating #offshorewind turbines are gaining ground. Danish project aims to make it cheaper/easier to produce floating foundations for deep water. See the four main challenges below. @DtuWind @dhigroup @HenrikStiesdal @SiemensGamesa @uwanews #windenergy
